problems.title: Count Vowels in a String
problems.description:
Count and print the number of vowels (a, e, i, o, u) in a given string. Consider both uppercase and lowercase vowels.

Input Format:
First line contains a string.

Output Format:
Print the count of vowels.
problems.examples:
Sample Input
Hello World

Sample Output
3

Explanation:
Vowels in "Hello World" are: e, o, o (total 3)
hintsList: Check each character if it is one of 'a', 'e', 'i', 'o', 'u' (or uppercase). Use a loop to iterate through the string.

problems.title: Reverse a String
problems.description:
Reverse the given string and print it.

Input Format:
First line contains a string.

Output Format:
Print the reversed string.
problems.examples:
Sample Input
Hello

Sample Output
olleH

Explanation:
Reversed "Hello" becomes "olleH"
hintsList: Use two pointers: start from the beginning and end, swap characters. Or create a new string by reading characters from the end.

problems.title: Check if String is Palindrome
problems.description:
Check if the given string is a palindrome. A palindrome reads the same forwards and backwards (ignoring case). Print "true" if palindrome, otherwise print "false".

Input Format:
First line contains a string.

Output Format:
Print "true" or "false".
problems.examples:
Sample Input
racecar

Sample Output
true

Sample Input
Hello

Sample Output
false

Explanation:
"racecar" reads same forwards and backwards, so it's a palindrome.
hintsList: Compare characters from start and end. Convert to lowercase before comparing if needed. Use two pointers.

problems.title: Count Words in a String
problems.description:
Count the number of words in a given string. Words are separated by spaces.

Input Format:
First line contains a string.

Output Format:
Print the count of words.
problems.examples:
Sample Input
Hello World Java

Sample Output
3

Explanation:
The string has 3 words: "Hello", "World", "Java"
hintsList: Split the string by spaces and count the parts. Or iterate through string and count spaces, then add 1.

problems.title: Convert String to Uppercase
problems.description:
Convert all lowercase letters in the string to uppercase and print the result.

Input Format:
First line contains a string.

Output Format:
Print the string with all letters converted to uppercase.
problems.examples:
Sample Input
Hello World

Sample Output
HELLO WORLD

Explanation:
All lowercase letters are converted to uppercase.
hintsList: Iterate through each character. If it's a lowercase letter (a-z), convert it to uppercase by subtracting 32 or using built-in functions.

problems.title: Remove Spaces from String
problems.description:
Remove all spaces from the given string and print the result.

Input Format:
First line contains a string.

Output Format:
Print the string without spaces.
problems.examples:
Sample Input
Hello World Java

Sample Output
HelloWorldJava

Explanation:
All spaces are removed from the string.
hintsList: Iterate through the string and only add characters that are not spaces to a new string.

problems.title: Count Characters in String
problems.description:
Count and print the total number of characters in the given string (excluding spaces).

Input Format:
First line contains a string.

Output Format:
Print the count of characters (excluding spaces).
problems.examples:
Sample Input
Hello World

Sample Output
10

Explanation:
"Hello World" has 10 characters excluding the space: H-e-l-l-o-W-o-r-l-d
hintsList: Iterate through the string and count only characters that are not spaces.

problems.title: Replace Character in String
problems.description:
Replace all occurrences of a given character 'oldChar' with 'newChar' in the string and print the result.

Input Format:
First line contains a string.
Second line contains oldChar (the character to replace).
Third line contains newChar (the replacement character).

Output Format:
Print the string after replacing all occurrences of oldChar with newChar.
problems.examples:
Sample Input
Hello World
o
e

Sample Output
Helle Werld

Explanation:
All 'o' characters are replaced with 'e'.
problems.constraints:
1 <= length of string <= 1000
oldChar and newChar are single characters
hintsList: Iterate through the string. When you find oldChar, replace it with newChar.

problems.title: Check if Two Strings are Equal
problems.description:
Compare two strings and print "true" if they are equal (case-sensitive), otherwise print "false".

Input Format:
First line contains first string.
Second line contains second string.

Output Format:
Print "true" if strings are equal, otherwise print "false".
problems.examples:
Sample Input
Hello
Hello

Sample Output
true

Sample Input
Hello
hello

Sample Output
false

Explanation:
First case: Both strings are identical, so true.
Second case: 'H' != 'h', so false.
hintsList: Compare strings character by character, or use built-in string comparison function. Check lengths first - if different, strings are not equal.

problems.title: Find Longest Word in String
problems.description:
Find and print the longest word in a given string. Words are separated by spaces. If there are multiple words with the same maximum length, print the first one.

Input Format:
First line contains a string.

Output Format:
Print the longest word.
problems.examples:
Sample Input
Java is a programming language

Sample Output
programming

Explanation:
Words: Java(4), is(2), a(1), programming(11), language(8). Longest word is "programming".
hintsList: Split the string by spaces to get words. Compare lengths of each word and keep track of the longest one. If lengths are equal, keep the first one.
